title: Peloton, Moderna, Marriott, Pfizer: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Popular pandemic trades were on display as Omicron anxiety gripped markets
text:
* Pfizer ticked up 1.1% premarket. The FDA could authorize Covid-19 boosters from Pfizer and BioNTech for use in 16- and 17-year olds as soon as next week.

* One outlier to this pattern was Moderna, which dropped 3.1% ahead of the bell. The vaccine maker's CEO said current shots are likely to struggle against the Omicron variant.

* Other pandemic plays that were on the rise premarket included Teladoc Health, up 1.1% and DoorDash, up 0.3%.

* Hotels were also caught in the pullback. Marriott International fell 2.3% premarket, Host Hotels & Resorts dropped 1.2% and Airbnb shed 2%.

* Regeneron Pharmaceuticals dropped 2.2% premarket. Preliminary tests indicate the Covid-19 antibody drug cocktail from Regeneron loses effectiveness against Omicron, the company said Tuesday, a sign that some products in an important class of therapies might need modifying if the new strain becomes widespread.

* Merck shares edged down 0.1% premarket. An outside panel of scientific advisers to the FDA is scheduled to meet Tuesday to discuss the experimental Covid-19 oral antiviral from Merck and partner Ridgeback Biotherapeutics.

* Salesforce, Hewlett Packard Enterprise and Box are among the companies reporting earnings Tuesday.

Chart of the Day

* Expect prices to swing around as markets try to get ahead of the science and assess the binary risk of new lockdownsâ€”or not, writes columnist James Mackintosh.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Peloton, Moderna, Marriott, Pfizer: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
